title: [Contemporary novelties in internal medicine].
abstract: Confronted with increasingly complex and interdependent medical situations, targeted clinical answers and recommendations are -increasingly the result of a comprehensive appraisal of existing -evidence. In addition, public health and economic stakes have to be considered and integrated into the decision process, diagnosis and management of numerous clinical entities. This selective overview covers some of these entities and demonstrate the expanding overlap between inpatient and outpatient practice.
